thread.title: Vegas cops in standoff after shooting outside Cosmopolitan
thread.title_full: Vegas cops in standoff after shooting outside Cosmopolitan

author: TERENCE CULLEN
title: Vegas cops in standoff after shooting outside Cosmopolitan

organizations.name: university medical center of southern nevada

text:
One killed in bus shooting as cops enter standoff with suspect outside Cosmopolitan on the Las Vegas Strip One killed on Vegas Strip, cops in standoff with suspect Cops shut down blocks of the Strip after the shooting. (via Twitter/@@khalili26 ) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Updated: Saturday, March 25, 2017, 4:18 PM 
One person was killed and another injured during a bus shooting Saturday outside the Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas — leading to standoff with the barricaded shooter on the Strip. 
The melee began shortly before 11 a.m. local time when shots went off on the bus near the Cosmopolitan and the neighboring Bellagio — where hours earlier a group of burglars tried breaking into a Rolex store. 
Dozens of police cars surrounded the double-decker bus, which was wrapped in advertisements. 
Two blocks of the Las Vegas Strip were shut down, and hotel guests were ordered to stay in their rooms. 
The suspect was barricaded on the bus, but Las Vegas Metropolitan police said, “There is no active shooter.” The standoff took place outside the Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas. (George Rose/Getty Images) 
One victim was brought to University Medical Center of Southern Nevada’s trauma center in an unknown condition, according to the Las Vegas Review-Journal. 
Hotel guests along the thoroughfare posted on Twitter that they were ordered to stay inside. 
One woman — who only identified herself as Anita — said she was walking on a skybridge to the MGM Grand from the Cosmopolitan when she saw the police activity.
